context.description: Message Flow editor canvas This is where you create message flows. To add nodes to your message flow, click a node from the palette and then click the canvas at the point where you want the node to be added.
Grid Properties dialog Use this dialog to define the horizontal and vertical spacing of the grid markers, and the margin between the borders of the editor area and the start of the grid markers.
Terminal Selection dialog Select the terminal on this node to which the connection will be made.

topic.label: Creating connections with the Terminal Selection dialog box
Creating node connections with the mouse

context.description: Web Services Provider Flow Subflow that parses SOAP request has been generated. Please build the flow logic that processes SOAP operation(s). Note that SOAP reply node has also been generated

topic.label: Creating applications using Configure New Web Service Usage wizard

context.description: Web Services Consumer Flow Subflow that allows invocation of synchronous-SOAP requests has been generated. Please build the flow logic that processes the Web-service response

topic.label: Creating applications using Configure New Web Service Usage wizard

context.description: WSDL Import Drag and drop an imported WSDL file from the Deployable WSDL category into the message flow editor to invoke the service or expose the message flow as the service.

topic.label: Creating applications using Configure New Web Service Usage wizard

context.description: Broker SCA Outbound Drag and Drop Dialog Select the operation that will call a service component on WebSphere Process Server. You can choose to invoke the service synchronously, using a SCARequest node, or to invoke the service asynchronously using a pair of SCAAsyncRequest and SCAAsyncResponse nodes.
